conclusion: To determine the direction of the acceleration during the 0 to 10 seconds interval, we need to analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph provided.
The x-axis represents time (t) in seconds. The y-axis represents velocity (v) in meters per second (m/s). The graph shows how the skydiver's velocity changes over time.
From 0 to 10 seconds, the velocity increases from 0 m/s to 20 m/s.
This indicates that the skydiver is accelerating during this interval.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time.
Since the velocity is increasing (going from 0 to 20 m/s), the acceleration is positive.
A positive acceleration in the context of this graph means the skydiver is accelerating downward.
The direction of the acceleration during the 0 to 10 seconds interval is downward.
